Name: loudoun_2008_lville_sanitary_manholes
Originator: Loudoun County, Virginia, Office of Mapping and Geographic Information (OMAGI)
OriginatorSort: Loudoun County, Virginia, Office of Mapping and Geographic Information (OMAGI)
Abstract: This feature class identifies all of the sanitary sewer manholes in the town of Lovettsville, VA.  It also includes information on the diameter, depth,   ID of each manhole.  All of the manholes with an ID number are located on a 2006 sanitary sewer map of Lovettsville, VA   were collected using the map as a field guide.  All other manholes collected will be assigned an ID number at a later date.
FgdcText:

  <idinfo>

</citeinfo>
    </citation>
    <descript>
      <abstract>This feature class identifies all of the sanitary sewer manholes in the town of Lovettsville, VA.  It also includes information on the diameter, depth, & ID of each manhole.  All of the manholes with an ID number are located on a 2006 sanitary sewer map of Lovettsville, VA & were collected using the map as a field guide.  All other manholes collected will be assigned an ID number at a later date.</abstract>
      <purpose>Sanitary manholes were collected at the request of the town of Lovettsville for town mapping purposes.  They can be used in town related planning projects to map the present infrastructure of the town.</purpose>
      <supplinf>Data are stored in the corporate ArcSDE Geodatabase as a point feature class.  The coordinate system is Virginia State Plane (North), Zone 4501, datum NAD83 HARN (vertical datum, if applicable, NAVD88), US Survey foot units.</supplinf>
    </descript>

      <timeinfo>

      </timeinfo>

    </timeperd>

  <dataqual>
    <attracc>
      <attraccr>Retention of attribute accuracy throughout the GPS data file to geodatabase feature class coversion process was ensured by a manual QA/QC programmatic check. To meet satisfactory QA/QC requirements the input data file and output feature class must have, on a record by record basis, identical attribution to all the user-defined attribution.</attraccr>
    </attracc>
    <logic>Topologically clean</logic>
    <complete>Features may have been eliminated or generalized due to scale and intended use. To assist Loudoun County, Virginia in the maintenance of the data, please provide any information concerning discovered errors, omissions, or other discrepancies found in the data.</complete>
    <posacc>
      <horizpa>
        <horizpar>Retention of coordinate accuracy throughout the GPS data file to geodatabase feature class conversion process ensured by following a specific differential correction process with GPS Pathfinder software.  
Base files for differential correction are downloaded from a Continuously Operating Reference Station (CORS) at Gaithersburg, MD.  The GPS data files are differentially corrected using the Standard Automatic Code Correction Process.  This process results in sub-meter accuracy for corrected data files; predominately at a 0.5-1 meter distance, with some files at 30-50 cm & 1-2 meters.  The corrected files are then exported using the County's standary projection & copied into the Lovettsville PGDB & appropriate feature class.  
To meet satisfactory QA/QC requirements the input GPS file and output feature class must have the same record total, and on a record by record basis, same location as corrected GPS files.  Features may be spatially adjusted using 2007 digital photography if higher sub-meter accuracy places them incorrectly.</horizpar>
      </horizpa>
      <vertacc>
        <vertaccr>A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the data set has either not been conducted, or is not applicable.</vertaccr>
      </vertacc>
    </posacc>
    <lineage>
      <srcinfo>
        <srccite>
          <citeinfo>

        <srccitea/>
        <srccontr>Request for assistance in data collection by Keith Markel, Lovettsville Town Manager in January 2008</srccontr>
      </srcinfo>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>GPS collection of all existing sanitary sewer manholes in the town of Lovettsville with Trimble GPS unit in two seperate groups.  A 2006 sanitary sewer map from R. Stuart Royer & Associates, Inc. was used as a reference to collect the first portion of sanitary manholes.  The map ID number for each was given to the corresponding GPS collected manhole in the field.  A GPS data dictionary was created & used to collect targeted attribute values for each feature type collected.</procdesc>
        <procdate>February 2008</procdate>
        <proccont>
          <cntinfo>
            <cntorgp>
              <cntorg>Loudoun County, VA, OMAGI</cntorg>
            </cntorgp>
            <cntpos>GIS Specialist</cntpos>
            <cntaddr>
              <addrtype/>
              <address/>
              <city/>
              <state/>
              <postal/>
            </cntaddr>
            <cntvoice/>
          </cntinfo>
        </proccont>
      </procstep>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>The second portion of manholes collected were all other existing sanitary manholes that were not located on 2006 sanitary sewer map.  These were concentrated primarily in the new developing areas of the town and around the town square which recently underwent a traffic pattern change.</procdesc>
        <procdate>February 2008</procdate>
        <proccont>
          <cntinfo>
            <cntorgp>
              <cntorg>Loudoun County, VA, OMAGI</cntorg>
            </cntorgp>
            <cntpos>GIS Specialist</cntpos>
            <cntaddr>
              <addrtype/>
              <address/>
              <city/>
              <state/>
              <postal/>
            </cntaddr>
            <cntvoice/>
          </cntinfo>
        </proccont>
      </procstep>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>GPS data downloaded from unit & then differentially corrected in GPS Pathfinder using base files from CORS at Gaithersburg, MD.  The Standard Automatic Code Correction process was used to correct the data, which resulted in a predominately sub-meter accuracy of .5 to 1 meters (1.5 to 3 feet). 
The differentially corrected data was then exported from Pathfinder as a sample shapefile & copied into the existing Lovettsville PGDB & corresponding feature class.</procdesc>
        <procdate>February 2008</procdate>
        <proccont>
          <cntinfo>
            <cntorgp>
              <cntorg>Loudoun County, VA, OMAGI</cntorg>
            </cntorgp>
            <cntpos>GIS Specialist</cntpos>
            <cntaddr>
              <addrtype/>
              <address/>
              <city/>
              <state/>
              <postal/>
            </cntaddr>
            <cntvoice/>
          </cntinfo>
        </proccont>
      </procstep>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>Dataset copied from the CD obtained from Loudoun County, VA in 2008</procdesc>
        <srcused>\\GIS-VISITOR\C$\Documents and Settings\VISITOR\Desktop\GeorgeMason\pgdb_SDE_5211.mdb</srcused>
        <procdate>unknown</procdate>
      </procstep>
    </lineage>
